section.title: Menus
section.para: This section provides a brief description of each menu option. Please choose a menu for more information.

listitem.para: Create a new, empty project. This is the same as quitting and starting the program over again. See for more information.
Open an existing project file, replacing your current project. See for more information.
Save the project you are currently working on. If the current project has never been saved, you will be prompted to provide a file name. See for more information.

Save the project you are currently working on under a new file name. This is convenient if you want to use an existing project as the base for a new project. You can open the existing project and then Save As... a new project file name. See for more information.

The Cut menu item will delete the currently selected photos in the Photos Tab and place them on the clipboard. This photos on the clipboard can then be pasted back via the Paste menu item.
The Copy menu item will copy the currently selected photos in the Photos Tab to the clipboard. This photos on the clipboard can then be pasted back via the Paste menu item.
Paste the photos on the clipboard into the position before the currently selected photo. If multiple photos or no photos are selected, then the photos will be pasted after the last photo in the show.
Deletes the currently selected photos from the show. You cannot undo a delete so please be careful when deleting photos.
If the Photos Tab is active, this selects all the photos. If one of the Transitions and Effects Tabs are active, this checks all the transitions and effects checkboxes on that tab.
If the Photos Tab is active, this deselects all the photos. If one of the Transitions and Effects Tabs are active, this unchecks all the transitions and effects checkboxes on that tab.

Switches PhotoPulse into expert mode when checked. See for more information.
Display an MP3 playlist editor dialog allowing you to create a playlist with multiple MP3 music files. See for more information.
Upload a show to your web site. See for more information.

Go to your hosting providers online file management site in your web browser. If the hosting provider you have currently selected does not support online file management, this menu item will be disabled.
View the most recently created show, e.g. this will display an HTML show in your web browser.
If neoDVD is installed and the most recently created show was a video format show, this will launch neoDVD with that video, allowing you to burn it to DVD.
Launches the help system where you can get information on how to use the program.
Describes the simplest and fastest means for creating a show.
Provides a popup screen where you can enter a license key to unlock the software. See for more information.
Launches your web browser to the PhotoPulse web site where you can register for additional information.
Displays a dialog which provides information on the software version and your serial number and license key information.
